> >  - uri-errors.log
> > 
> >    URIs which are discovered but are too problematic to
> >    crawl.
> 
> Are we going to include rejected (malformed) urls in this log?
> It would nice to have a log that will list all of rejected URLs.
> This will help with a link extractor debugging.

Yes, that's exactly the idea, because for now there's a lot
of these errors: 
  (1) URIs that are so corrupt/illegal that neither java.net.URI
      nor a typical browser could do anything with them.
  (2) URIs that a browser might be able to coerce into a usable
      form, but which java.net.URI does not accept.
  (3) False URIs, created by errors in our extraction code. 

We'll want to fix (3); work around (2) so that we do as much
as a browser would; and reliably recognize (1)s as URIs we
can confidently ignore.  Eventually, only the (1)s would 
remain in the uri-errors.log.

- Gordon
